intro: Myrmechila platyptera, commonly known as the flat-winged millipede, is a species of millipede characterized by its elongated, segmented body and distinct, flattened thorax. It belongs to the family Polydesmidae and is native to regions of Southeast Asia, including parts of India and Indonesia. The plant-like appearance of its body, with numerous legs and a segmented exoskeleton, contributes to its camouflage in forest floor environments. It plays a role in soil aeration and nutrient cycling through its burrowing behavior. Myrmechila platyptera is primarily nocturnal and feeds on decaying plant matter and organic debris.
